channel.title: Comments on: Adding a jQuery Date Picker to Sharepoint
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: La'Creda
item.dc:creator: La'Creda
item.description: Don't waste your time..... this does not work.
item.content:encoded: Don’t waste your time….. this does not work.

item.title: By: david
item.dc:creator: david
item.description: I am trying to use this solution with SharePoint 2007 and Firefox. I am unclear on how to change the column id to include DateTimeFieldDate. In your screen shot the column is called created on. How was the id changed to include DateTimeFieldDate?
item.content:encoded:
I am trying to use this solution with SharePoint 2007 and Firefox. I am unclear on how to change the column id to include DateTimeFieldDate. In your screen shot the column is called created on.
How was the id changed to include DateTimeFieldDate?

item.title: By: sam
item.dc:creator: sam
item.description: will this this date picker a default if the date picker control is added .<br /> Coz the current date picker doesnt serve itz purpose.coz you cant change the year like windows 7 date control.
item.content:encoded:
will this this date picker a default if the date picker control is added .
Coz the current date picker doesnt serve itz purpose.coz you cant change the year like windows 7 date control.

item.title: By: Mario
item.dc:creator: Mario
item.description: and in the newform.aspx code sets? Thank You
item.content:encoded:
and in the newform.aspx code sets?
Thank You

item.title: By: ca8msm
item.dc:creator: ca8msm
item.description: Yes, kind of. The default date picker didn't want to work with Firefox and needed to be specifically clicked on whereas the jQuery one pops up once you click into the actual date field (and looks nicer IMO).
item.content:encoded: Yes, kind of. The default date picker didn’t want to work with Firefox and needed to be specifically clicked on whereas the jQuery one pops up once you click into the actual date field (and looks nicer IMO).

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.description: Mark, are you just overwriting the default date picker associated with a date field in SharePoint? I'm kind of missing the point.
item.content:encoded: Mark, are you just overwriting the default date picker associated with a date field in SharePoint? I’m kind of missing the point.
